articles.title: Report: White House locking down messaging from federal government on coronavirus
articles.description: New York Times reporting finds that the White House is directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements with Vice President Pence’s office

articles.title: Facebook's coronavirus response could lead to regulation
articles.description: Washington Post reporter Tony Romm says the stakes "are pretty high" for Facebook over how it responds to coronavirus misinformation.

articles.title: As the country worries about the coronavirus, Trump tries to...
articles.description: As the country worries about the coronavirus, Trump tries to discredit institutions and the media. Chuck Todd says, "Just yesterday, Mr. Trump attacked press outlets he doesn't like, claiming they're trying to make him look bad by inducing panic.”

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What is the coronavirus and what are the symptoms?
articles.description: Ali Velshi takes a closer look at symptoms of the coronavirus and how it compares to other major respiratory diseases.

articles.title: Markets plunge again amid coronavirus fears

articles.title: Is the White House starting to censor public-health officials?
articles.description: Muzzling experts before they can answer questions might save Team Trump some embarrassment, but it fixes the wrong problem.
articles.content: The New York Times has an interesting report this afternoon on the administration's response to the coronavirus outbreak, noting for example, that Donald Trump told associates that he put Mike Pence in charge of the response because the vice president didn't … [+2229 chars]

articles.title: How to protect yourself against coronavirus
articles.description: Dr. Matt McCarthy, author of "Superbugs: The Race To Stop An Epidemic" and Dr, Vanessa Raabe, an infectious disease specialist at NYU Langone Health, speak with Chris Jansing about ways you can protect yourself from catching and spreading coronavirus.

articles.title: Sen. Braun: 'Long way to go' on Coronavirus preparedness

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Stock market plunges as coronavirus fears grip Wall Street
articles.description: The New York Stock Exchange and the Dow Jones Industrial Average continue to plunge amid global coronavirus concerns, marking worst week for Wall Street since the financial crisis.

articles.title: Rep. Ami Bera on possible Coronavirus case near his district

articles.author: Msnbc
articles.title: With the pressure on, Trump flubs another leadership test
articles.description: Even when it's in his interest to at least try to be a grown-up, Donald Trump can't stop being Donald Trump.
articles.content:
After Donald Trump announced that he'd hold a press conference on the coronavirus outbreak, the stage was set for an important presidential leadership test. In theory, it was one that the Republican should've been able to pass with relative ease.
After all, … [+1492 chars]

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Senator skeptical of Trump response to coronavirus
articles.description: Sen. Chris Coons, D-Del., discusses the president's briefing on the threat of the coronavirus and explains why he's skeptical of the administration's response.

articles.author: Msnbc
articles.title: Why Pence is an unfortunate choice to oversee coronavirus response
articles.description: Trump said Pence is "really very expert in the field" of public health. I wish this were true. It's not.
articles.content: Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar was on Capitol Hill yesterday, where he fielded a question from a lawmaker who asked about the possibility of a "czar" to coordinate the federal response to the coronavirus outbreak. The cabinet secretary was dism… [+2485 chars]

articles.title: Trump addresses coronovirus surrounded by public health experts.
articles.description: The president on Wednesday tried to ease growing fears over the spreading coronavirus, saying at the White House that his administration has the situation under control and is 'ready to adapt' if the virus spreads. The panel discusses.

articles.title: Trump gives 'incoherent' briefing on coronavirus, contradicts CDC
articles.description: President Donald Trump gave a press briefing on COVID-19, naming Vice President Mike Pence the head of his administration's response to the potential pandemic. Asked about the likelihood of a U.S. outbreak, Trump said, "I don't think it's inevitable" - which …

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Walls and bans not a good strategy for addressing coronavirus
articles.description: Christopher Mores, virologist and public health professor at George Washington University, talks with Rachel Maddow about why improving our understanding of the transmission of coronavirus is a better strategy than trying to wall off the country.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Virologist: Good testing key to coronavirus containment
articles.description: Christopher Mores, public health professor at George Washington University, talks with Rachel Maddow about the importance of reliable testing of coronavirus to understand and control its spread.

articles.title: Rates of lethality, transmission shape coronavirus concerns

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Markets tanked on coronavirus fears. Trump blamed Democrats.
articles.description: Trump used a briefing meant to calm fears about the coronavirus to say stock markets are down because of fears about the Democratic candidates. But markets are down worldwide, and it's because of coronavirus. Maya Wiley and Rick Wilson discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump picks Pence to lead coronavirus response. Is the VP ready for it?
articles.description: Some of the president's critics say he should put a health professional in charge of his administration's coronavirus response. Instead, he picked Mike Pence who has in the past had a tenuous relationship with science.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Reality of coronavirus will challenge Trump's habit of making things up
articles.description: Trump has shown a tendency towards telling his own version of events rather than sticking to the truth. But the reality of a potential coronavirus outbreak is likely to test his ability to craft the narrative.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump attacks Dems and contradicts CDC with a false coronavirus outlook
articles.description: During a press conference meant to calm public fears over the coronavirus, Trump played loose with the facts and attacked his political rivals.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Dr. Hotez explains the trajectory of the coronavirus in the U.S.
articles.description: Global health expert Dr. Peter Hotez speaks with Chris Hayes about the spread of the coronavirus and what can and should be done.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: World Health Org Official: Trump’s press conference on coronavirus ‘incoherent’
articles.description: On President Trump's press conference regarding the coronavirus, World Health Organization Special Adviser to the Director Dr. Ezekiel Emanuel says "I found most of what he said incoherent."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: White House briefs on coronavirus concerns
articles.description: President Trump had a press conference from the White House briefing room. The rare briefing comes amid increased anxiety over the global spread of the coronavirus.

articles.title: Coronavirus crisis? Dr. Howard Dean says Trump lying about looming medical crisis
